## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
library(readr); 
library(dplyr); 
library(stringr); 
library(tidyr); 
library(lubridate); 
library(ggplot2)

inc <- read_csv("ups_quarterly_income.csv")
bs  <- read_csv("ups_quarterly_balance.csv")
cf  <- read_csv("ups_quarterly_cashflow.csv")
all <- read_csv("ups_quarterly_all_statements.csv")

# peek
glimpse(all)
all %>% count(statement) # should show quarterly_income / quarterly_balance / quarterly_cashflow
all %>% distinct(metric) %>% arrange(metric) %>% print(n = 50)

```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

```{r}
# Show first 6 rows of each
head(inc)
head(bs)
head(cf)
head(all)
```
